Baked Mac and Cheese

Jump to Recipe

Baked Mac and Cheese is the ultimate comfort food, perfect for family gatherings, potlucks, or a cozy night in. This creamy and cheesy dish combines the timeless flavor of macaroni pasta with a rich, velvety cheese sauce that will satisfy any cheese lover's cravings. With just a few simple ingredients like shredded cheddar cheese, milk, and a hint of butter, you can create a mouthwatering meal that is both indulgent and easy to prepare. Whether you're a novice cook or a seasoned chef, this baked mac and cheese recipe is incredibly straightforward, making it an ideal choice for busy weeknights or special occasions. Plus, the crispy breadcrumb topping adds a delightful crunch that elevates this classic dish to new heights. Dive into this delicious recipe, and discover how to make the best baked mac and cheese that will have everyone asking for seconds!

Ingredients

macaroni pasta

Use elbow macaroni for the traditional shape, but you can substitute with other pasta shapes like shells or fusilli. Ensure you cook the pasta al dente, as it will continue to cook in the oven and prevent it from becoming mushy.

shredded cheddar cheese

Sharp cheddar adds a strong flavor, but feel free to mix with other cheeses like Gruyère or Monterey Jack for complexity. For a creamier texture, consider using Velveeta or a cheese sauce blend.

milk

Whole milk gives the creamiest results, but you can substitute with 2% milk or a non-dairy milk like almond or oat milk for a lighter version. If using non-dairy milk, ensure it is unsweetened.

butter

Unsalted butter is preferable so you can control the salt levels in your dish. For a healthier option, you can use olive oil or a dairy-free butter substitute.

all-purpose flour

This is used to thicken the cheese sauce. You can substitute with whole wheat flour for a nuttier flavor or cornstarch for a gluten-free option (use 1 tablespoon of cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons of cold water instead of flour).

breadcrumbs

Panko breadcrumbs give a lighter, crunchier texture compared to regular breadcrumbs. You can also use crushed crackers or even cornflakes as a topping for added flavor.

salt

Adjust the salt based on the saltiness of your cheese. You can also use flavored salts like garlic or herb salt to enhance the dish further.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper offers the best flavor. For a different kick, consider adding a pinch of cayenne pepper or smoked paprika for a smoky flavor.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Begin by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C). This ensures that your baked mac and cheese cooks evenly and gets that perfect golden top.

  • Step 2: Cook the Macaroni

    In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add a pinch of salt. Cook the macaroni pasta (2 cups) according to the package instructions until al dente (firm to the bite), usually around 7-8 minutes. Drain the macaroni and set it aside. Expert Tip: Rinse the macaroni briefly under cold water to stop the cooking process and prevent sticking.

  • Step 3: Prepare the Cheese Sauce

    In a medium saucepan, melt 4 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Once melted, add 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, stirring continuously for about 1 minute until the mixture becomes bubbly. This is called a roux and will help thicken your cheese sauce.

  • Step 4: Add Milk and Thicken

    Gradually whisk in 2 cups of milk into the roux, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Keep cooking for about 5 minutes until the mixture thickens and bubbles gently. Expert Note: Make sure to use whole milk for a creamier texture.

  • Step 5: Incorporate Cheese

    Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese until completely melted and smooth. Season with 1 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper to enhance the flavor.

  • Step 6: Combine Macaroni and Cheese Sauce

    In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked macaroni with the cheese sauce. Stir well to ensure every piece of macaroni is coated with the cheesy goodness.

  • Step 7: Prepare for Baking

    Transfer the macaroni and cheese mixture into a greased baking dish. Evenly sprinkle 1 cup of breadcrumbs over the top for a crunchy finish. This will add texture and contrast to the creamy dish.

  • Step 8: Bake

    Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and bubbly. Keep an eye on it to prevent burning. Expert Tip: For an extra crispy topping, you can broil it for an additional 2-3 minutes at the end of baking.

  • Step 9: Serve and Enjoy

    Once baked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving. This will allow the cheese sauce to set a bit. Serve warm and enjoy the creamy, cheesy goodness of your baked mac and cheese!

Frequently Asked Questions

What does 'al dente' mean when cooking pasta?

'Al dente' means the pasta is cooked until it's firm to the bite. It should be slightly undercooked since it will continue to cook when mixed with the cheese sauce and baked.

How do I know when my cheese sauce is thick enough?

The cheese sauce is ready when it coats the back of a spoon. If you can run your finger through it and the line stays, it's thick enough!

Can I use pre-shredded cheese?

Yes, pre-shredded cheese is convenient, but it often contains anti-caking agents that can affect the melting quality. For the best texture, try shredding your own cheese from a block.

What can I substitute for butter?

You can use olive oil, margarine, or even a dairy-free butter substitute if you're looking for a healthier option or have dietary restrictions.

How do I prevent the pasta from sticking together?

After draining the pasta, toss it with a little olive oil to prevent sticking. Also, make sure to stir it occasionally during cooking.

What is the purpose of baking the mac and cheese?

Baking gives the mac and cheese a nice golden top and allows the flavors to meld together. The breadcrumbs add a delicious crunchy texture.

How do I safely handle hot ingredients?

Always use oven mitts when handling hot pans or dishes. Keep a safe distance from hot surfaces and avoid touching them directly with your skin.

How can I tell when my mac and cheese is done baking?

It's done when the top is golden brown and bubbly. A knife inserted into the center should come out hot and clean.

Can I add other ingredients to my mac and cheese?

Absolutely! You can add cooked vegetables, bacon, or even different types of cheese for extra flavor. Just be mindful of the additional moisture they may bring.

What should I do if my sauce is too thick?

If your cheese sauce is too thick, whisk in a little more milk over low heat until you reach your desired consistency.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free version, substitute regular macaroni with gluten-free pasta and use gluten-free breadcrumbs. To make it vegetarian, ensure that the cheese used is rennet-free. For a lighter option, use low-fat milk and cheese or a cauliflower-based mac and cheese recipe. If dairy-free is required, consider using plant-based cheese and milk alternatives.

Pairings

For a complete meal, serve the baked mac and cheese alongside a light salad with arugula, cherry tomatoes, and a lemon vinaigrette to balance the richness. Grilled chicken or smoked sausage can add a protein boost. For beverages, pair with a crisp white wine like Sauvignon Blanc or a light lager for those who prefer beer. A refreshing iced tea with lemon is also a great non-alcoholic option.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the baked mac and cheese hot from the oven in individual ramekins for a more upscale presentation. Garnish with freshly chopped parsley or chives for a pop of color and flavor. Consider adding a sprinkle of paprika or crushed red pepper flakes for a subtle kick. For an added crunch, mix some crushed crackers into the breadcrumbs before topping the dish.

Baked Mac and Cheese

45 min
$8
500 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Tags:

Comfort FoodCheesyPasta

Description

Creamy, cheesy pasta baked to golden perfection!

Ingredients

  • macaroni pasta: 2 cups
  • shredded cheddar cheese: 2 cups
  • milk: 2 cups
  • butter: 4 tablespoons
  • all-purpose flour: 2 tablespoons
  • breadcrumbs: 1 cup
  • salt: 1 teaspoon
  • black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon
